meanings.definition: To become hardened or solidified by the deposition of calcium salts.
meanings.sent1: Over time, the bone calcifies and becomes strong.
meanings.sent2: The shell of the egg calcifies as the chick develops inside.
meanings.sent3: The old milk left in the fridge calcifies into a solid mass.
meanings.sent4: Her determination calcifies into an unbreakable resolve.
meanings.sent5: The once flowing river calcifies into a frozen stream in winter.

meanings.definition: To make or become inflexible or rigid.
meanings.sent1: The glue calcifies and holds the pieces together.
meanings.sent2: His stubbornness calcifies his ability to compromise.
meanings.sent3: The idea of wearing socks with sandals calcifies his sense of fashion.
meanings.sent4: Fear calcifies his heart, making him unable to love again.
meanings.sent5: The strict rules calcify the once creative environment into a dull routine.
